data.title: Ubuntu Touch
data.meta_description: Ubuntu Touch is a mobile version of the Ubuntu operating system, being developed by the UBports community. Its user interface is written in Qt, and is designed primarily for touchscreen mobile devices such as smartphones and tablet computers, but the original goal of convergence was intended to bring Ubuntu Touch to laptops, desktops, IOT devices and TVs for a complete unified user experience.
data.text:
"Ubuntu phone" redirects here. For the proposed smartphone, see Ubuntu Edge.

Ubuntu Touch is a mobile version of the Ubuntu operating system, being developed by the UBports community.[3][4][5] Its user interface is written in Qt, and is designed primarily for touchscreen mobile devices such as smartphones and tablet computers, but the original goal of convergence was intended to bring Ubuntu Touch to laptops, desktops, IOT devices and TVs for a complete unified user experience.
